I think Dead by Daylight is a really good game, no joke here. 

I'm pretty sure that there are tons of negative reviews out there saying that "the game is too frustrating" or that "it's hard to win at" or that it's "unbalanced" but, to be honest, what would you expect from a game where there is one killer who needs to kill four survivors? Of course you can get salty if something doesn't go your way, but it doesn't mean that the game is bad - you only need to change your attitude towards it. And here are some tips from me:

- Don't play it too often. The more you play, the more there is a chance that you can get frustrated with the game, and there are numerous reasons for that, don't even get me started.

-Play both sides. Play Survivor with friends - this can be super fun. Killer you will need play alone, but it seems like with the new system, the game matches you with starting Survivors if you haven't played enough as Killer, so technically you shouldn't be getting hard-try survivors in the beginning.
Playing both sides helps to understand the game better: you will be aware of all ins and outs of playing against each side. Useful.

-Playing as Survivor, don't think that you have to escape at all times or even most - killers need to kill, don't forget that, but if you played well, you will be well rewarded.

-Playing as Kiler, don't think that you have to kill all survivors - survivors need to escape (taking one or two is often enough), but if you played well, you will be well rewarded here too. What's more, the payoff is really better here - you can get twice as many points as Survivors at the end of the game.

-Watch some streamers play DbD - don't think right away that the way you played was the only possible one, and that you didn't have a chance to escape/kill.
I personally am a big fan of Otzdarva - by looking at how others play, you can easily pick up some useful techniques for surviving, looping, juking, killing, pressuring, etc.

Last but not least, I want to say that the developers are super supportive of their child - we get new killers, survivors, and maps almost every 3 months, I think, so the game is getting better and better only!

Give it a go! See you in the fog ğŸ˜Œ

This is a great game that seems to have hit the sweet spot when it comes to asymmetrical horror/survival games.  
I think about this game a lot.  Starting as both a killer or survivor instill in me the same mix of excitement and dread.

Edit: Still love this game.

A pretty fun game. Some killers camps, some survivors are just horrible teammates--those are the sort of things you have to deal with in games like this. Despite this, DBD is honestly one of the most fun horror games I have ever played. I'll be honest though, it doesn't scare me much after about 400 hours. :')
